abstract: In praise of Google Docs, a free Internet-based word processing application that also allows for offline use.
snippet: In praise of Google Docs, a free Internet-based word processing application that also allows for offline use.
lead_paragraph: I recently bought a MacBook Air so that I could have an ultra lightweight computer for traveling and for days when I need to work outside my home office. Because it’s my second computer, I didn’t want to spend money on software. Whenever I used it to create documents, I figured I’d just work in “the cloud,” meaning that I’d store things on the Internet rather than on the computer’s hard drive. I was already a heavy user of Google Docs, a free word-processing application that allows users to easily share documents with other people. So I thought I’d just use that as my word processing program on the new computer. Then I started worrying — did I really want to rely on being able to get Internet access every time I wanted to work on a document?

headline.main: Computing in the Cloud, With Suspenders

abstract: The fight over the Google-Yahoo partnership shows how much Microsoft has learned about working in Washington, and how much Google has yet to learn.
snippet: The fight over the Google-Yahoo partnership shows how much Microsoft has learned about working in Washington, and how much Google has yet to learn.
lead_paragraph: After Google and Yahoo announced an advertising partnership in June, letters from consumer groups and advertising associations poured into government regulators, urging them to support or block the proposed deal.

headline.main: Google Learns Lessons in the Ways of Washington
headline.print_headline: Google Learns Lessons in the Ways of Washington

abstract: After Google and Yahoo announced an advertising partnership in June, letters from consumer groups and advertising associations poured into government regulators, urging them to support or block the proposed deal.
lead_paragraph: After Google and Yahoo announced an advertising partnership in June, letters from consumer groups and advertising associations poured into government regulators, urging them to support or block the proposed deal.

headline.main: Google Learns Lessons in the Ways of Washington

abstract: In a week when many tech companies are going to report earnings, questions abound about Yahoo’s future, Apple’s immunity to the economic downturn and more.
snippet: In a week when many tech companies are going to report earnings, questions abound about Yahoo’s future, Apple’s immunity to the economic downturn and more.
lead_paragraph: When it comes to third-quarter revenue, we found out that the Obama campaign blew through analysts’ expectations. Google didn’t do too badly, either. But this week we’ll have a lot more indicators from technology companies that may not be leading such charmed existences.

headline.main: Quick Bits: Pain at Yahoo and Other Pressing Questions
